conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

At this stage, our decision is primarily driven by our admissions priority order (i.e., we must consider families in a specific sequence when we have only one place). Because we still need to keep the place available in case a higher-priority family applies in upcoming rounds, we’re not in a position to make an offer to you right now.

There isn’t an additional document, schedule adjustment, or condition you could meet that would change that priority order. If the situation changes (e.g., no higher-priority applications materialize), we would reassess.

Given the uncertainty, we also encourage you to continue actively pursuing your other preferred nurseries in parallel.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your thoughtful follow-up.

We can’t reliably predict (or share) whether specific higher-priority families will apply in the remaining rounds, because families’ application choices can change quickly depending on outcomes elsewhere.

What I *can* share is our process: with one place, we keep it available while there remains a realistic chance that a higher-priority family may still apply. If we reach a later stage of the process with no higher-priority applications materializing, we will reassess and may then be able to finalize the place.

Practically, a reasonable point for that reassessment is around the later part of the window (e.g., after round 20). If you are still seeking a place at that time, please message us immediately (an [APPLY] at that point is fine), and we will review promptly based on the then-current situation.

In the meantime, I do encourage you to continue pursuing your other preferred nurseries in parallel, given the uncertainty.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

[TALK]

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest and for offering to prepare documents in advance.

Given we have a single place and must follow our priority sequence, the earliest concrete checkpoint we can commit to is **after round 15**. If by the end of round 15 we have not received an application from any family who is ahead of you in our priority order, we will reassess immediately. At that point, if the seat is still open, you are welcome to send a fresh **[APPLY]** and we will be able to make a prompt decision based on the then-current situation.

If you’d like to be ready for a same-day turnaround, you can also send (in advance) any standard items you already have on hand (e.g., child details, start-date preference, contact information), but please note that documents alone cannot override the priority order.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for confirming your continued interest and readiness to move quickly.

**Best way to reach us at the start of round 16:** please send your message directly through this platform as a fresh **[APPLY]** at the start of the round. We monitor messages throughout the round and will respond as promptly as possible once we complete the post–round 15 reassessment.

**What to include in your round-16 [APPLY] for fastest processing:**
1) Child’s name and date of birth (or age)
2) Preferred start date (and whether you are flexible)
3) Schedule needed (days/hours) and any flexibility
4) Parent/guardian contact details (email + phone)
5) Any relevant notes (e.g., siblings, special considerations) if applicable
6) A clear statement that you can accept immediately if offered

You’re welcome to prepare these details now so your round-16 application is complete, but as noted previously, documents/details help with speed only and do not change the priority-order requirement.

Sincerely,
Nursery_A Admissions
